pr_title: [dart-dio] Adds support for generating inline enums

timeline.message:
[dart-dio] Adds support for generating inline enums

Previously these were generated as strings if declared inline in the spec.

timeline.bodyText: why this is only for inline enums? look like the is no check for inline so all enum will be handle like this no ?
timeline.author: jaumard

replies.bodyText: I think if the enum is actually a schema, then isEnum returns false. I'll need to check that though.
replies.author: josh-burton

replies.bodyText:
@jaumard sorry the delay, finally had time to look into this to confirm.
isEnum is false for enums that are declared as definitions rather than inline, so only inline enums will be affected.
Here's the output from generating petStore with debugModels true:

  PetStatus as inline enum
{
  "openApiType" : "string",
  "baseName" : "status",
  "getter" : "getStatus",
  "setter" : "setStatus",
  "description" : "pet status in the store",
  "dataType" : "String",
  "datatypeWithEnum" : "StatusEnum",

  "defaultValue" : "null",

  "example" : "null",
  "jsonSchema" : "{\n  \"type\" : \"string\",\n  \"description\" : \"pet status in the store\",\n  \"enum\" : [ \"available\", \"pending\", \"sold\" ]\n}",

  "isCircularReference" : false,
  "_enum" : [ "available", "pending", "sold" ],
  "allowableValues" : {
    "enumVars" : [ {
      "name" : "available",
      "isString" : true,
      "value" : "\"available\""
    }, {

    }, {

  "enumName" : "StatusEnum",
  "uniqueItems" : false,
  "isXmlAttribute" : false,
  "isXmlWrapped" : false,
  "datatype" : "String",
  "iexclusiveMaximum" : false
} ]

Previously these were generated as strings if declared inline in the spec.
